title: Bug Tracker
description:
This fields describes the source control repository for this distribution.

Because a URI like `https://myrepo.example.com/` is ambiguous as to type, producers should provide a `type` whenever a `url` key is given. The `type` field should be the name of the most common program used to work with the repository, e.g. git, svn, cvs, darcs, bzr or hg.

url.description: A URI pointing to the repository itself.

web.description: A URI pointing to a web front-end for the repository.

type.description: a lowercase string indicating the VCS used.
